thread.title: Las Vegas casinos not rushing to join daily fantasy sports game
thread.title_full: Las Vegas casinos not rushing to join daily fantasy sports game

title: Las Vegas casinos not rushing to join daily fantasy sports game
text: By KIMBERLY PIERCEALLAssociated Press LAS VEGAS (AP) - Casinos and sports books may be the only businesses in Nevada that can legally offer daily fantasy sports statewide but no one's rushing to join the game.It has been more than a week since Nevada regulators told the daily fantasy sports industry to get a gambling license or get out and two top companies inferred regulators played favorites to protect casinos and sports books.Gambling companies including MGM Resorts, Caesars and sports book William Hill are instead watching from the bleachers as other states weigh in and federal investigations heat up.Observers say no one wants to risk their valuable gambling licenses to get into a business that's still in a legal gray area and requires a large number of players, especially new ones, to make the financials work.
